issue.title: [Python] Faster boundschecking of dictionary indices when converting to Categorical
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6645](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6645). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This was added at some point to fix a bug. I suspect we might want to move this check somewhere else rather than do it every time `to_pandas` is called

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6645?focusedCommentId=17133860) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I'm just changing things to use the vectorized boundschecking for better speed

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6645?focusedCommentId=17134359) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7414
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7414>
